**[5-46]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[IM
AQ6370D-01EN]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:6.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[Explanation]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#ffffff"}**

[Data measurement or signal sweeping starts when triggered by an
external signal.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[An external trigger input terminal is located on the rear panel of the
instrument. Input
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[signals are of TTL levels.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[SMPL TRIG:
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Measurement starts per external trigger signals. You can set
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[whether the trigger activates on a rising or falling edge of the
signal.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Measurement starts approximately 70 µs after the trigger activates.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[SWEEP TRIG:
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Sweeping starts per external trigger signals. The trigger activates on
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[the rising/falling edge of the signal. Sweeping starts 5 ms at most
after
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[the trigger
activates.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[SMPL ENABLE: A single or repeat sweep starts when the external trigger
signal level is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[low. The sweep is stopped when the signal level becomes high. If the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[signal level becomes low again, the sweep starts from the point that it
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[stopped
at.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Signal Logic and Delay Time (for SMPL
TRIG)]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[EDGE]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This key is used to set the external trigger signal detection
edges.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[RISE:
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The rising edge is recognized as a
trigger.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[FALL:
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The falling edge is recognized as a
trigger.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[DELAY
\*\*\*\*.\*µs]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This key is used to set the delay time between trigger signal edge
detection and data
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[measurement. The setting range is 0 to 1000.0 µs (fine: steps of 0.1;
coarse: steps of 1).
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[For information about the external trigger measurement function, see
section 2.2.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Smoothing
Function]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This function attenuates the noise in the measured waveform. By using
the Smoothing
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[function, areas on the waveform with a large amount of noise can be
"smoothed out"
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[when measured. Note that when noise is superimposed on abrupt changes
in the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[spectrum, the peaks and valleys of the spectrum are integrated thereby
reducing the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[measurement resolution. Therefore, it is recommended not to use the
Smoothing
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[function all the time, but rather to use it judiciously, checking the
effects on the measured
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[spectrum. Also, if a relatively small number of samples is set relative
to the measurement
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[span (or example, when UNCAL is displayed), the appropriate Smoothing
function may
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[not be
performed]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Active
Trace]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Active trace refers to a target trace to which settings and changes can
be
applied.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[A trace shows a waveform and measurement conditions. The instrument has
a total of
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[seven independent traces (A through G). You can specify Show/Hide on
each trace, and
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[display multiple traces in the waveform screen.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The following explains the soft keys related to trace settings.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[ACTIVE
TRACE...ABCDEFG]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Selects the active trace from among traces A to G.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[You can also switch the active trace using the mouse by clicking TRACE
display A
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[through G on the
screen.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Displaying
Traces]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Selects whether or not to display the active trace on screen.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[VIEW @...DISP /
BLANK]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

["VIEW @ DISP": Displays the waveform on the screen. The trace display
changes to
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[\"DSP\".
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

["VIEW @ BLANK": Does not display the waveform on the screen. The trace
display
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[changes to \"BLK\".
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When you press this key, the highlight toggles between "VIEW @ DISP"
and "VIEW @
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[BLANK".]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Note that if BLANK is set, markers applied to the trace set in DISP
will be
cleared.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The \"at\" (@) symbol indicates the currently selected trace. One is
included from A to G.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Write
Mode]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[WRITE
@]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This key is used to set the active trace to write
mode.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When a trace is set to write mode, waveform data are written to it and
updated during
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[measurement. In addition, the trace display on the side of the data
area changes to
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[\"WRITE\".]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The \"at\" (@) symbol indicates the currently selected trace. One is
included from A to G.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Fixed
mode]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[FIX
@]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This key is used to set the active trace to data fixing
mode.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When a trace is set to this mode, its waveform data do not change even
when
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[measurement is performed. Therefore, the waveform on the screen is not
overwritten.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The trace display changes to
\"FIX\".]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When the FIX soft key is pressed during sweeping, the waveform
displayed at that time
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[is fixed.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The \"at\" (@) symbol indicates the currently selected trace. One is
included from A to G.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[6]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:14.0pt;color:#ffffff"}**

**[Explanation]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#ffffff"}**

[The instrument detects the peak (the maximum level value) or bottom
(the minimum level
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[value) of the measured
waveform.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[PEAK
SEARCH]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[A peak search (a search for the maximum level value) is performed on
the active trace
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[waveform. The moving marker is displayed at the peak point, and the
marker value is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[displayed in the data area. If the peak is off the screen, its marker
is displayed at the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[top or bottom edge of the screen. Even in this situation, the correct
marker value is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[displayed.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[A grid table lists wavelengths (frequencies) that are referenced by

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

custom Grid table.

**[Standard Grid
Table]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This Grid table is created with pre-defined wavelength (frequency)
ranges.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[It can be created in the following manner by setting the reference
wavelength (frequency)
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[and frequency
spacing.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

SPACING]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

WAVELENGTH]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Sets the grid table reference wavelength. This can be set in the range
of 1000.0000 to
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[1700.0000
nm.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

Table]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

freely.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[wavelength (frequency), and frequency
spacing.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

***[1.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}***[
Set up a light source such as a DFB-LD with a spectrum width that is
narrower
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[than the instrument's resolution (with a wavelength of 1310 nm or 1550
nm).
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

***[2.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}***[
Connect the light source and the instrument using an optical fiber cord
and set the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[instrument's resolution to 1.000 nm.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

***[3.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}***[
Execute measurement and determine the peak level.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

***[4.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}***[

a light
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[power meter to measure the light power.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

***[5.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}***[
Calculate the difference between the peak level value obtained from the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

set this
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Absolute Level
Accuracy]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The instrument's absolute level is calibrated with a 9.5 μm single-mode
optical
fiber.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The level accuracy when other optical fibers are used is not
guaranteed.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Multimode (GI) fiber provides a relatively accurate spectrum if the
light source is
low-]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[coherent light such as white light, natural light, or an LED. If the
light source has high
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[coherency as in the case of a laser beam, interference will occur
inside the optical fiber,
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[and the intensity distribution of light radiating from the fiber tip
will vary according to the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[fiber form. As a result, the spectrum (measurement level) may fluctuate
if the fiber is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[moved.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When an optical fiber with a large core diameter or large NA value is
used, a low fraction
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[of the light emitted from the optical fiber is received. Therefore, the
measurement level is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[lower than the true value, but the optical spectrum is accurate in
relative terms.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[WL SHIFT
\*\*.\*\*nm]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This key is used to set the wavelength
shift.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When the wavelength shift is changed, the set value is added to the
display value on
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[the wavelength axis. This key is used for purposes such as correcting
differences in
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[wavelength display values among different measurement
instruments.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The setting range is -5.000 to 5,000 nm. Settings can be adjusted in
steps of 0.001 nm.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The value changes in steps of 0.1 nm if you press the COARSE key.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When setting the wavelength shift amount,
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ is displayed at the bottom of the screen
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[in inverse video.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[LEVEL
SHIFT\*\*\*.\*\*\*dB]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This key is used to set the level
shift.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When the level shift is changed, the set value is added to the display
value on the level
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[axis.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[This key is used for purposes such as correcting level errors due to
differences in the NA
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[values of 9.5/125 μm SM optical fibers connected to the instrument, and
correcting loss
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[on externally connected isolators, filters and the like.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The setting range is -60.00 to 60.00 dB. Settings can be adjusted in
steps of 0.01 dB.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The value changes in steps of 0.1 dB if you press the COARSE key.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When setting the wavelength shift amount,
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ is displayed at the bottom of the screen
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[in inverse video.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Explanation]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#ffffff"}**

[You can save data from traces A to G to internal memory or a USB
storage medium, or
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[assign previously saved data to trace A to G and display it.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Also, you can save (MEMORY) data that was temporarily saved to internal
memory or a
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[USB storage medium, or register previously saved data to the temporary
save memory.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Extensions]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

.CSV]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

Name]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

setting.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Data
Format]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Data can be saved in the following two formats.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[BIN]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Saves the file in binary
format.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[With this selection, the waveform data cannot be directly checked using
an external
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[application. The file size is smaller than that obtained with ASCII
format.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[CSV]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Saves the file in CSV (Comma Separated Value) ASCII
format.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[With this selection, the waveform data can be directly checked using an
external
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[application. The file size is larger than that obtained with binary
format.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[File
Size]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The file size differs depending on the data saved. Be sure to check
whether sufficient
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[space is available before saving.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[File
Sort]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[You can sort the file list in ascending order by file name, file type,
file date, or label.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Note]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[• In principle, only soft keys that are displayed after pressing a
function key can be registered.

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Automatic
Offset]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[When the AUTO OFFSET is set to ON, the offset of the internal amplifier
circuit is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[adjusted at time intervals of approximately 10 minutes. (Default:
ON)]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[If the AUTO OFFSET is OFF, the auto-offset adjustment operation is not
performed.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When you switch from OFF to ON, the offset adjustment is executed
immediately.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[When switched to ON, the offset adjustment is performed during repeat
sweeping when
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[sweeping reaches 100%. During a single sweep, the offset adjustment is
performed
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[when the sweep is completed.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[During offset adjustment, a message indicating that the offset is being
adjusted is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[displayed in the lower-left corner and in the center of the top part of
the
screen.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ ]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Note]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[If, during offset adjustment, you use key operations or remote commands
to execute a sweep,
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[the sweep will start after the offset adjustment is

[1. Apply channel detection to measured waveform data using the
following
procedure:]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Find all maximum points and minimum points to obtain mode peaks where
peak/]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[bottom differences between maximum points and minimum points on both
sides
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[are equal to or greater than MODE
DIFF.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Of the obtained mode peaks, choose only the ones whose level
difference
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[compared to the highest peak is equal to or greater than THRESH. Note,
however,
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[that mode peaks with a level difference equal to or less than DISPLAY
MASK
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[shall be excluded. The number of mode peaks chosen in this manner shall
be the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Number of Channels
"N."]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[2. Obtain the wavelength
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}[λ]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}['i
of each mode
peak.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[3. Determine the center wavelengths λi of each mode peak, which are 2
points down
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[A\[dB\] to the left and right from mode peak λ\'I (where A\[dB\] is 3
dB or the MODE DIFF

**[Algorithm for

[1. WDM analysis is performed on the signal optical waveform data of
TRACE A to
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[perform channel detection. However, the DISPLAY MASK parameter is not
used.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[2. The center wavelength λi of each channel and signal optical level
LIN'i of TRACE A
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[optical signal are determined according to the SIGNAL POWER parameter
setting. (The
